newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan cotton rates steady on exporters' demand.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan cotton rates steady on exporters' demand.

text.p: Pakistan cotton rates held steady on Saturday on demand from exporters in Punjab province and can rise in the coming weeks if the arrival of 1997/98 (July-June) crop is delayed by rains, dealers said.

"Sindh province has run out of 1996/97 crop cotton stocks, but there is demand both from exporters and mill owners in Punjab province," dealer Mustafa Hussain said. "The cotton rates will rise if rains delay the arrival of the new crop."
Dealers said ginners had about 450,000 bales (375 lbs each) of unsold cotton. In the kerb market, the NIAB-78 variety was traded at 2,200 rupees ($54.33) per maund (37.32 k.g.).
Saturday's official spot rates issued by the Karachi Cotton Association in rupees per maund, including 10 percent sales tax:
